Blood Helpline no
Missing Persons Bureau

Safety Instructions

1. Avoid all travels at night. Never get into a cab or auto that already occupied with any passenger. 
2. Your eye contact with stranges should be brief and never intimating. 
3. Act confident and try not making enquiries from strangers. 
4. Keep some speed-dial numbers and some self-defence devices handy. 
5. Carry a pen knife or pepper spray for self-defense. A torch is handy if the lights go off. 
6. Avoid late night travelling to suburbs when you are alone. If you have to, take someone along. 
7. Don’t ignore, Raise your Voice calmly, firmly, and without insults or personal attacks to let them know that their actions are unwelcome, unacceptable, and wrong. 
8. Scream, be confident and be loud enough when you confront the harasser. 
9. Don’t hesitate to take help of bystanders.


 Role of Bystanders


As a bystander, try to intervene in the matter where women might require help. In such situation yell, scream and draw more public attention. If you come across any situation of violence on women, engage the victim in some way that will distract from harasser. Ex: ‘Can you tell me the time?’ ‘I need to go there, which train I must take?’ . Call on Helpline numbers and report about the harassment that you witnessed. 

Warning: Any Misuse of this Service is a Punishable Offence Under the Law.


Note: This service is completely free. Standard SMS charges are applicable as per your telecom subscriber plan. 

For any queries,mail us at
